title: "Perfection": Take That fans send Twitter into meltdown as Robbie Williams performs with band on Let It Shine

There were doubts he wouldn't be able to perform on Saturday after pulling out of his guest judging role 24-hours earlier. 
But Robbie Williams didn't disappoint Take That fans as he joined Gary Barlow, Howard Donald and Mark Owen to sing on the grand finale of Let It Shine. 
Taking to the stage to perform The Flood, the pop icons brief return to the group managed to send social media into meltdown, as viewer's declared it 'perfection'. Read More Five To Five are crowned the winners of Let It Shine as they beat Nightfall and Drive Robbie Williams and Take That's performance was "perfection" (Photo: PA) 
Following their emotive live performance of the song, which saw Robbie taking centre stage for much of the song's intro, fans heaped praise on both the Angel's singer, 43. 
Clearly delighted with the brief reunion, the band's loyal fan base took to Twitter in their droves. 
"Nothing makes me happier than seeing Robbie perform with take that again," wrote@sashmountcastle. 
While another devoted fan labelled the performance "perfection", with @_zoemarie24 writing: 
"For three minutes I was 12 again dancing around my living room! Take that + Robbie = perfection!" 
Others were just as taken, and the praise kept pouring in for the Party Like A Russian singer and the three stalwart members of the band. 
"Robbie and Take That still showing the world how it's done after all these years," wrote @charlottep1971. 
Ther was some uncertainty as to whether he would be even taking to teh stage though, as the singer pulled out of his guest judge role on the live final due to an "ailment" at the last minute. 
The BBC confirmed on Friday that comedian Peter Kay was stepping in for Robbie on the programme. Read More Peter Kay steps in for Robbie Williams in Let It Shine final - dressed as Honey G Robbie had to pull out of his judging role, but still took to the stage to sing (Photo: PA) 
However, they did insist that Robbie would still join Take That for a special performance on the show, as originally planned . 
The band took to the stage just before the winner was announced, with Gary and Robbie being joined by Howard Donald and Mark Owen for a special performance of their single, The Flood. 
Taking his place was Peter, 43, who brought his own unique spin to the show by dressing up as infamous X Factor flop, Honey G. Like us on Facebook
